fields.description:
If you happen to delete a User record from the user_base DB table, then try to views an Issues votes, or watches where that user was one of he watchers or users, then you get errors and stacktraces in the logs.
In order to handle external user management systems deleting users that are watchers and/or voters, we should be able to handle the user details disappearing, and just display the username without stacktraces.
Note that normal use with JIRA user management is NOT buggy, because deleting the user through admin page will delete the appropriate user_association records and update the vote counts accordingly.
fields.summary: Watches and Votes cannot handle users "disappearing" (ie being deleted from external user management).

fields.description:
Screenshot Applet: Paste button not working on Safari 3.1.1 / Mac OS X 10.5.3

Overview: screenshot applet loads but when the "Paste" button is selected nothing happens.

Steps to repro:

1. Start the "Grab" program built-in to Mac OS X
2. Shift-Command-A to start select region mode
3. Select a part of the screen to grab. A window appears with the selection
4. Edit->Copy or Command-C to copy
5. Open an issue in Jira 3.12.2-#300.
6. Click the "Attach Screenshot" link. A window opens and the applet loading graphics show up. The screenshot applet appears
7. Click the Paste button

Expected behavior: The image grabbed on the screen shows up in the applet.

Observed behavior: No image appears.

Further steps:

A. Click Attach. Nothing happens.
B. Move the mouse over the "Paste" button. Click and release but don't move the cursor. As long as the mouse stays on or very near the Paste button, it remains in the "mouse-down" UI state (dark blue). Move the cursor out and the button returns to its normal state.
fields.summary: Screenshot Applet: Paste button not working on Safari 3.1.1 / Mac OS X 10.5.3
Customfield with context (issue type) does not appear on the quick subtask creation form

fields.description:
[Quick Search|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/quicksearch.html] allows you to search for versions that start with a string. For example "v:3.0" will return issues that have version "3.0" and version "3.0 enterprise". However, it will not return issues that have version "3.0.1" or "3.0.0.4". That is, for the version to match, there must be a space immediately after the string specified in the quick search.

This improvement request is to remove this shortcoming, so that a search on "v:3.0" will return issues in version "3.0.1" and "3.0.0.4". It is, of course, common for customers to use "x.y.z" style version names, and as such to have a desire to be able to search on "x.y.*".

The limitation (and this improvement request) also holds for quick searching on Fix For Version using "ff:xyz".
fields.summary: Quick Search on Version or Fix For Version should match against versions that start with the specified string but do not contain a space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15088].
  {panel}

Commonly our IT department will create a mailbox on the wrong server causing the following exception to the log:

[quote]
2008-06-11 11:24:25,244 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-0 ERROR [service.services.mail.MailFetcherService] Messaging Exception in service 'com.atlassian.jira.service.services.imap.ImapService' when getting mail: A2 NO There is no replica for that mailbox on this server.;
  nested exception is:
        com.sun.mail.iap.CommandFailedException: A2 NO There is no replica for that mailbox on this server.
javax.mail.MessagingException: A2 NO There is no replica for that mailbox on this server.;
  nested exception is:
        com.sun.mail.iap.CommandFailedException: A2 NO There is no replica for that mailbox on this server.
        at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPFolder.doCommand(IMAPFolder.java:2125)
        at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPFolder.exists(IMAPFolder.java:406)
        at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPFolder.checkExists(IMAPFolder.java:280)
        at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPFolder.open(IMAPFolder.java:779)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:160)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:61)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
[quote]

Two things should be changed to better help identify problems like these:

a.) The account with the problem should be printed to the log so an admin can actually figure out problem accounts.
b.) The admin interface should turn accounts red (and preferably show error message) for problem accounts.

a is much easier and much higher priority than b.
fields.summary: Notify which mail accounts have errors

fields.description:
I find that the Quick Search is not able to locate characters that are part of a larger string.  For example, I have a task with this phone number, 800-461-2273, in the title, and in numerous comments.  Yet, when I use Quick Search and the term "2273", the task is not retrieved.  

I've tried the Query syntax from the documentation, http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/querysyntax.html, and the task is still not found.

Here are the Quick Search terms that I've tried which do not retrieve the proper task.

2273 - this obviously fails, as Quick Search thinks I've asked for a JIRA task number.
"2273"
"-2273"
"*2273"
"?2273"

Am I doing something wrong, or is the search method limited in its ability to find a subset of characters within a string?
fields.summary: Search, Quick Search doesn't find characters within a word

fields.description:
Try following URL (replace username and password):
http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?&sorter/field=issuetype&sorter/order=ASC&pager/start=0&tempMax=50&os_username=XXX&os_password=XXX
fields.summary: JIRA RSS feed returns #esc instead of proper values on JAC

fields.description:
This is a feature request for exporting filtered issues into a more usable report.

When exporting a list of issues to excel, a number of our customers we scrub with do not have access to the Jira server we use.
Due to this, images and links to issues are invalid and are required to be added manually. This is very time consuming.

The suggestion would be to have an export option that will

a) Create a front or master page that displays the fields set up by your customised filters
b) An extra worksheet/tab is created for each issue, with every detail of the bug, including images or log files embedded
c) The master page links for the issues will reference to the specific worksheet
fields.summary: NEW FEATURE : Export to Excel to create 1 Mastersheet and extra worksheets with detailed bug reports (including images and attachments)

fields.description:
JIRA is not able to detect the new PKCS signature file's content type (as the content type has been changed from "application/x-pkcs7-signature" to "application/pkcs7-signature") in the email that is fetched from POP, hence the file will be added as an attachment in the issue instead.

Old content type: application/x-pkcs7-signature
New content type: application/pkcs7-signature

Please see the RPC: http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc2311.txt
fields.summary: New PKCS7 signature file is not recognizable by JIRA (content type: application/pkcs7-signature)
Allow work logs to be moved between tasks

fields.description:
1) Start filing a bug against Bamboo.
2) Wait 30 minutes (or however long the session timeout is).
3) Finish editing the bug.
4) Submit

Since your session is expired, you're taken to a page indicating that you don't have permission to submit a bug without logging in. All the work you have done is discarded. Hitting the back button does not take you back to the form you just submitted.
fields.summary: Sent information is lost when data is submitted after session has expired

fields.description:
*Use case:*
The operator ( - ) doesn't work.  And the NOT either.  Example:  When I do a filter and would write something like that in the query :      gmap -jesse   I would expect to have all the comments / description / summary with the word MAP and WITHOUT the word jesse to come out.  I tried like GMAP NOT JESSE and GMAP -"approved by jesse", but it never check my ( - ) or NOT.  

Thanks.

Martin Poirier
Ubisoft Montreal
fields.summary: Search across fields

fields.description:
IE 8 will have a different CSS and JavaScript bahaviour. IE 8 is scheduled for release in August.

To ensure that JIRA ocntinues to work in IE 8 we need to add:
<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=7" />
to JIRA's HTML pages.
fields.summary: Add IE 7 compatibility meta tag to JIRA pages to ensure they render correctly in IE 8

fields.description: When I attach an XML schema file with a .xsd extension to a JIra ticket, Jira reports application/octet-stream as the MIME type.  It is the second attachment on the ticket.
fields.summary: .xsd file as an attachment does not get proper MIME type

fields.description:
it would be nice if the email handlers (we use Non Quoted Comment Handler FWIW) could remove signatures as they clutter up the comments significantly. 

Looking for "-- \n" for example would be a good start as that is the standard and would at least help.  I appreciate that flexibility here is probably highly desirable.  perhaps if the email consists of:

new stuff
| quoted text
new stuff2

then it's more likely that "new stuff2" is a signature, but you certainly wouldn't want to assume it.
fields.summary: remove signatures from inbound emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15069].
  {panel}

Issues created/commented on via email often have too much whitespace - double spaces between lines, etc. This makes the resulting descriptions/comments hard to read.

One solution would be to allow the user to specify two new parameters on the 'createissue' and 'createorcommentissue' handlers. These would be as follows:
regex = regular expression to match with in replaceall
regexreplace = what to replace every found instance of 'regex'

I have made these changes to my version of 3.12.3 code and attached the modified files. Three files were modified:

com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateOrCommentHandler
com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateIssueHandler
com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.FullCommentHandler
fields.summary: Apply regular expression to email'd issue create/issue comments (remove spaces)

fields.summary: Assignable permission given to User CF value causes errors in logs

fields.description: I suspect, but have done nothing to actually confirm, that these temp files are created as temporary files but aren't flagged as "delete on exit".
fields.summary: Importing creates temporary files that are not deleted upon jvm exit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15060].
  {panel}

We have two current support requests in which customers would like to be able to create issues from emails that have a blank subject. They state that they cannot guarantee that users will always enter a subject in their email, but that they still really want issues to be created for these emails.

Our current CreateIssueHandler rejects emails that do not have a subject.

So this improvement request is that we consider providing a configuration option so that administrators can decide whether they want emails with no subject to be:
- rejected, or
- accepted with some default subject, with maybe the ability to specify what the default subject would be.
fields.summary: Allow issues to be created from emails that do not have a subject

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15059].
  {panel}

Currently the JiraLuceneFieldCache has a cache that does nothing (this is one purpose).  The cache used to be in place (but I am sure it was broken back then) bu it was disabled.

It used by Both Lucene and 1/2DimensionalermHitCollectors  and anything else that uses the StatisticAccessorBean.searchCountMap().

This creates an index the size of the index that sticks around for the request and does not cache it.
There was an old cache in place but Scott removed this around 3.8.

Options:
# Fix cache - add caching to getMatches() but not for getCustom().
# Switch everything that use this to use a DocHitCollector (a LOT more memory efficient but may need to do performance hits).
fields.summary: One/TwoDimensionalTermHitCollectors use StatsJiraLuceneFieldCache with no cacheing
Umlauts are wrongly encoded when clicking on XML link when viewing the issue

fields.description:
To reproduce this bug:

On the "Manage Versions" page of a project that has existing versions,

1.  Add a new version (A) to the *top* of the list without a description
2.  Add another new version (B) to the top of the list without a description
3.  Edit  A.  Add a description.
4.  Edit B,  the Schedule field is incorrect.  It is set to "Before First Version", It should be A.
fields.summary: Editing Version info adds incorrect schedule data .

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15055].
  {panel}

On the SL JIRA someone suggested color coding for comments. https://jira.secondlife.com/browse/WEB-688

This shouldn't be too hard to do, just a few extra css classes for comments and changes.

The attached greasemonkey script is for Firefox 3 only due to using semitransparent colors (rgba). It color codes comments based on Reporter, Assignee and by last name (i wrote it for the SL Jira).

EDIT: The attached versions are old, get the latest version here: http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/27838
fields.summary: Color coding of comments based on group, reporter and assignee

fields.description:

Possibly other symbols could trigger the error as well.

fields.description:
To be consistent with all the other input fields.

Why you'd want to do that rather than click on the text field itself? Not sure, but I just did it! (habit perhaps)
fields.summary: Clicking on "Quick Search" should move the cursor to the input field

fields.description:
So that it's then one click away from creating a JIRA issue (the JIRA project comes preselected)

Although maybe you want to show people the dashboard... Dunno
fields.summary: "Bug/feature request" link should go to /browse/JRA

fields.description:
It is quite easy to get portlets into a bad shape.
E.g. Deleting customfields for 2dStats Portlet

We should put a nice big high level try/catch block in - {{com.atlassian.jira.web.portlet.bean.PortletRenderer.renderPortlet}} or {{com.atlassian.jira.portal.PortletImpl.getViewHtml}} that at least logs:
{{An error was thrown while try to render portlet: *1234*}}
This would make debugging of support cases much, much easier.

We can either rethrow the error or print a nice message:
{{We were unable to render this portlet due to an internal error.    Please contact your JIRA Administrator}}
fields.summary: Add better debugging information to portlet rendering
SSO credentials not used in IssueViewURLHandler

fields.description:
I would like to see the ability for a user to create a folder or container to sort Jira Issues into. Something that is only viewable on their dashboard and does not affect the issue itself.

Example:

-  I have 40 issues on my dashboard.
-  I would like to create a folder, that no one else can see, called "Stuff I dont care about" and move 20 issues into it.
-  I would like to create another folder called "Work that has to be done" and move the rest into it.
fields.summary: Add issues to Folders or Containers

fields.description:
i.e. to be able to easily differentiate an issue created/comments by email as opposed to be created/comments within the Jira interface.

this would help the programmer in more easily being able to control jira email spam

right now my workaround to differentiate between for example an issue created by email, is to set the" time spent" of that issue to Long(1), err in my listener's workflowEvent()
fields.summary: Specify the source of an action such as comment added in the generated event. For example web interface or email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15045].
  {panel}

When a plugin adds a custom-field, or service, or some other configurable element to JIRA -- these elements are seen in the administration panel and can be deleted. Later when upgrading it might be that this particular plugin is not needed anymore, and thus it is discarded.

One such example is the Perforce plugin and the new Beta Fisheye-Perforce, the old Perforce plugin is not really needed anymore and the two plugins are not compatible so the old one is not included in the installed war.

Thing is -- the custom fields, and services of that plugin are still in the database -- there is currently no way other than to dig into the database directy to remove these fields and services. And when running JIRA it is causing (non critical) errors that get logged.

Example of logged errors for custom fields:
{code}
ERROR [jira.issue.managers.DefaultCustomFieldManager] Could not find any custom field value
with key 'com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.perforce:hiddenjobswitch'.
ERROR [jira.issue.managers.DefaultCustomFieldManager] Could not find any custom field value
with key 'com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.perforce:jobcheckbox'.
{code}

Example for services:
{code}
ERROR [atlassian.jira.service.OfBizServiceConfigStore] Unable to create a service config for
service with name: Perforce Changes Indexing Service
com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceException: Could not find
class: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.perforce.changelists.ChangesIndexService
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceFactory.getService(ServiceFactory.java:36)
        . . .
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.perforce.changelists.ChangesIndexService
        at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.loadClass(WebappClassLoader.java:1363)
        . . .
{code}

Would it not be better to have these "defunct" elements seen as "broken" in the administration panel and safely removed from there, without tampering with the database?
fields.summary: Make existing components such as services that are supplied by plugins visible in administration section even if the plugin is missing

fields.description: It isn't possible to delete (shared) filter of other users. Only the owner of the filter can delete it.
fields.summary: Shared filter of other users couldn't be deleted

fields.description:
I' m working with many Projekts and our Projektleads define many shared filters.
So I'd like to disable or hide some of this filters in my different views .
fields.summary: Manage Filter should be more customizable

fields.description:
Currently the working hours per day and the working days per week are set globally. 
Some projects require an individual working "calendar" for planning and estimating purposes. Therefore it would be helpful, if these settings could be done at project level rather than JIRA level
fields.summary: Allow project specific configuration of working hours per day and working days per week

fields.description:
Currently, re-ordering of a scheduled version list for a project can only be done via the GUI, 1 at a time. 

For large use cases with many versions, (hundreds) it would be handy to have a button which automatically sorted the version list, in both Ascending and Descending directions.
fields.summary: ordering of the scheduled version list should be sortable by alphanumeric value

fields.description:
*Steps To Reproduce:
1) Be logged out of JIRA
2) Click on a link that takes you to a JIRA report

*Expected Result:
If you're not logged in, JIRA should tell you that you need to login.

*Actual Result:
It puts up a confusing Report configuration page and says:
Filter with id '12350' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it
fields.summary: When linking to a specific report, if the user is not logged in, do not display filter config options, but instead prompt the user to login
New notification type: Subtask changed/closed

fields.description:
When using the QuichSearch form, the mouse is always used to take the focus on the input field.
But, as the *log Out* link is just above !current.linkOnTopBar.png!, one time on 5, I click on it.

Is it possible to take way this two component :
* like this !proposed.linkOnTopBar.png!
* or this !other.proposed.linkOnTopBar.png!
* or any other valid solution
fields.summary: Avoid non wanted log out

fields.description: In the issues comment, the WIKI renderer is active for normal comment and comment on attachement, but not for comment on work log. To have WIKI rendered comment for the work log will make the system more consistent.
fields.summary: Add WIKI renderer for comment in Log Work Done

fields.description:
Please upgrade oscore to 2.2.7. This is available in our mvn repo.

See https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/XPR-525 for more details.
fields.summary: Upgrade to OSCore 2.2.7

fields.description:
One of our users, username "Minuteelectron", accidentally changed the project lead of his project to "MinuteElectron" (note the case difference).  This user doesn't exist.  After this, he was unable to perform any actions he should have been as the project lead.  However, when clicking on the 'project lead' username link, I was taken to the user's profile page.  It seems that JIRA can't decide whether "Minuteelectron" and "MinuteElectron" are the same user.

Either:
- The user should still have access as the project lead, or
- Visiting the profile page of a non-existent user should return an error

(I think the second option would be more correct, since usernames seem to be mostly treated as case-sensitive.)

Also, it seems dubious that JIRA allowed the project lead to be changed to a non-existent user in the first place.

I've attached a screenshot showing the inconsistency on the profile page; note the difference between the username on the page, and the username in the browser URL bar.

If it makes any difference, we use Crowd (1.4) for JIRA's authentication.
fields.summary: inconsistent handling of username case

fields.description: When reviewing the JIRA Extension Library, there is now way to identify which Plugins are authored by Atlassian and of those which are supported without drilling down on the individual extension.
fields.summary: JIRA Extensions from Atlassian and Supported should be clearly indicated
Wiki Renderer creates HTML that causes MS Word 2007 / Outlook 2007 to crash
RendererPreviewAjaxUtil should be aware of project & issue type context when creating a new issue

fields.description:
I have a bookmark to create an issue on EACJ:

https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa

At the moment, when I go there and I'm not logged in, I get the following message:

"You have not selected a valid project to create an issue in."

It should be "You do not have permission to view this page" -- the normal permission denied page.
fields.summary: Create issue screen shows incorrect error message when not logged in and login required
Improve the Issue Links column in Issue Naviagtor

fields.description:
Could you explain how in database scheme workflow scheme is represented via tables? It isn't clear how these 4 tables are interconnected: JIRAWorkflows, WorkflowsEntity, WorkflowScheme and Project.

Actually, we need database scheme. Because there is no foreign keys and connections between tables. 
Please, provide it to us.

Thank you in advance.
fields.summary: Database Scheme
Add a option to make the created and updated fields to show time and not just date in Issue Navigator
Internet Explorer fails to open time report excel sheet if accessed through bookmarked or written directly in URL

fields.description:
For system version field searchers, the SELECT list contains actual values for Released and Unreleased Versions, so you can effectively search for any released or unreleased versions.

For custom version field searchers, the SELECT list uses option groups to differentiate the versions in the UI, but functionally this means you can only search for versions you select.
fields.summary: Make the "grouping" of released / unreleased versions consistent across searchers for system and custom fields

fields.description:
Brad Baker's recent ShipIt project contained the following gems to help support:
- [improved SOAP access logging|http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~bbaker/2008/05/18/FEDEXVII+-+WebResourceManager+tweaks%2C+JIRA+SOAP+and+HTTP+logging#FEDEXVII-WebResourceManagertweaks,JIRASOAPandHTTPlogging-JIRASOAPaccesslogs]
- [improved HTTP access logging|http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~bbaker/2008/05/18/FEDEXVII+-+WebResourceManager+tweaks%2C+JIRA+SOAP+and+HTTP+logging#FEDEXVII-WebResourceManagertweaks,JIRASOAPandHTTPlogging-JIRAHTTPaccesslogs]

Can we please make sure these go into a JIRA release some time soon?
fields.summary: Improved SOAP and HTTP access logging

fields.description: A Bugzilla import just finished, and all users marked as CC are correctly added to the Watchers for the JIRA issue. Clicking on a user in the watch list for the issue shows all the other issues the user is watching. The tooltip text says "Find all issues <user name> voted on". Shouldn't this say "Find all issues <user name> is watching"?
fields.summary: Tooltip text for watchers refers to voters

fields.description:
Trying to create a support request (Administration > Support Request) from within a JIRA instance running in Weblogic 9.2 on Windows fails with a 500 error and the following stack trace:

{noformat}
org.apache.velocity.exception.VelocityException: Could not find template 'templates\email\text/jirasupportrequest.vm' 
ensure it is in the classpath.
        at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.getEncodedBody(DefaultVelocityManager.java:85)
        at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.getEncodedBody(DefaultVelocityManager.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.JiraSupportRequest.doExecute(JiraSupportRequest.java:207)
        at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
        at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:54)
        at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:211)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:856)
        at weblogic.servlet.internal.StubSecurityHelper$ServletServiceAction.run(StubSecurityHelper.java:225)
        at weblogic.servlet.internal.StubSecurityHelper.invokeServlet(StubSecurityHelper.java:127)
        at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl.execute(ServletStubImpl.java:283)
        at weblogic.servlet.internal.TailFilter.doFilter(TailFilter.java:26)
        at weblogic.servlet.internal.FilterChainImpl.doFilter(FilterChainImpl.java:42)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.AccessLogFilter.doFilter(AccessLogFilter.java:73)
        at weblogic.servlet.internal.FilterChainImpl.doFilter(FilterChainImpl.java:42)
        at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.parsePage(PageFilter.java:119)
        at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.doFilter(PageFilter.java:55)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.SitemeshExcludePathFilter.doFilter(SitemeshExcludePathFilter.java:38)
        at weblogic.servlet.internal.FilterChainImpl.doFilter(FilterChainImpl.java:42)
        at com.atlassian.seraph.filter.SecurityFilter.doFilter(SecurityFilter.java:192)
        at weblogic.servlet.internal.FilterChainImpl.doFilter(FilterChainImpl.java:42)
{noformat}

Note that there are both forward and backward slashes in the path to the template: 'templates\email\text/jirasupportrequest.vm'.

The error occurs both when JIRA is deployed as a WAR file and when it is deployed as an expanded WAR directory.

The error does not occur when for JIRA running in Weblogic 9.2 MP0 on Linux. Creating a support instance works fine in that environment.

I have not tested on other versions of Weblogic, nor on service packs of Weblogic 9.2. Let me know if you need me to.
fields.summary: Can't create a support request from JIRA in Weblogic on Windows and from Tomcat with enclosed JIRA WAR file: Could not find template 'templates\email\text/jirasupportrequest.vm'

fields.description:
Ordering should be the same as the ordering in the View Project (Admin) screen.
* *Components* - alphabetical (case insensitive?)
* *Versions* - sequence
fields.summary: Fix ordering of versions and components values on the View Issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15010].
  {panel}

Bulk move of a large number of issues from one project to the other.  Expected the order of creation of issue to match the original, it appears to be random.  For instance, if I bulk move X-1, X-2, X-3,  I would expect something like:
* X-1 -> Y-101
* X-2 -> Y-102
* X-3 -> Y-103
Either make the order predictable or option to specify the order. For instance, the order displayed in the UI.  In our case, the order in the UI was ascending by issue number, so expected result to be the same.
fields.summary: Bulk move - ordering

fields.description:
When you move a bug from one milestone to another, that has implications for all the linked bugs/tasks It would be helpful for Jira to present a tree of the linked bugs/tasks with their milestones so that you can a) assess whether you should really should be making that change and b) have an easy one-button method to adjust everything in the tree to match.

Can we also get a report that flags any incompatible milestone settings (i.e. task/bug A is set for completion April 1, but is marked as blocked by task/bug B which is set for completion May 1. Either A needs to move to May 1 or B needs to move to April 1.

It would be even better if we had a way to mark when work on a task has actually begun (see https://jira.palm.com/browse/ES-2398 ) and then a way to generate reports that flag which bugs/tasks are due in some period of time N (say, 2 weeks from today) and have blocking bugs/tasks on which work has not yet begun.
fields.summary: JIRA should present a tree view of linked bugs when milestone change is made

fields.description:
When I define a certain order in the Version Management page, I expect it to order accordingly in all version lists, not only the Affected/Fix Version but also the custom fields with Version Picker.
When the Affect version (and Fix version) sort in ascending order for Released versions, then the Released Versions in custom fields (defined as Version Picker) sort in reverse order.  Unreleased Versions are OK, they act the same way on all lists.
{quote}
Example:

    You can change the order in Version Management to make all versions descending for a Version Picker custom field, but then this is the way it acts:
        * custom field list: descending both for Unreleased and Released versions
        * Affected/Fix Version list: descending for Unreleased but *ascending for Released versions*
{quote}
fields.summary: Order defined in Version Management is different between Affect/Fix version and Version Picker custom field

fields.description:
Searching for "Übersetzung" gets the correct results, but searching for "Übersetz*" does not return any result.
Happens in Quick Search and in Filter.

We use  Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.12.3-#302)

Thanks, Max
fields.summary: Text-Search using Wildcards and German Umlauts does not work

fields.description:
JIRA should display the custom filed column despite the restriction placed on the custom filed and if any of the returned issues are not configured with the given custom filed, JIRA could indicate this fact by displaying *N/A* for those issues.

Currently, if one searches in Issue Navigator over multiple projects or issue types configured to display a custom field that is constrained either by Issue Type or Context and not all returned issues are configured with the custom filed, Issue navigator will not display the column for this custom filed.

You will only ever see the custom filed column if all the issues in the view are of the same issue type and that issue type is the one your custom field is configured for. I'm assuming the reason for this is that it can be misleading to show a column with no values for issues that can not even have that value assigned.

However, many users recognise the current JIRA behaviour as either misconfiguration of their installation or a bug in the application, which automatically results in new SAC cases.




Currently, a possible workaround this restriction/limitation is to configure the custom fields with the global context or perform a search only on a given Issue Type that the custom field is configured with.
fields.summary: Show custom field in search when searching in multiple projects/contexts

fields.description: Currently by the UI it's only possible to log work done on an issue using the 'log work done' issue link under issue operations. In some instances it may be convenient to be able to log the amount of work done on an issue at the resolve stage, to save time. Currently if you add the time tracking field to the resolved screen, only the 'estimated work remaining' can be entered.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to log work done on an issue at the resolved step in a workflow
add handler-parameters to Create-Issue Handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15002].
  {panel}

There are two new Workflow Transition Conditions that we'd like:
- User Is In Field
- User Is In Multi-User Field

The two are quite similar, what we really want is the latter.

The condition here is that the user who attempts to execute that transition should be referenced in a named field on the issue.

So assume a support workflow with an approval step. The support person says "in order to give privileges to System X, one of managers A, B, or C must approve the request." The support person puts A, B, and C into the "Approvers" field, and only A, B, or C can approve the request to go forward.

This is logically EXTREMELY similar to "User Is In Group Custom Field", except that it relies on individual users rather than JIRA groups.
fields.summary: "User is in Multi-User Field" Condition on Workflow Transition

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian Team,
we would appreciate if you would implement a new feature called "User Account Expiration Date".
In Jira User administration there should be a possibility to set an expiration date for an account.
We Use Jira internal and for our customers. So we have many Customer Accounts running, but we don't have 
an overview if the user of the customer account is still an employee of our customer. For some Projects we have
special security orders from our customers.  And we don't want that someone can get information from our jira, if he 
isn't still an employee. So it would be a very helpful feature. For completion an automatically deactivated user should have
a "button" to ask jira administrator or project administrator for reactivation. 

Thanks a lot for implementing in the future :-)
fields.summary: Set User Account Expiration Date

fields.description: You've been Skitchclapped!
fields.summary: GO JRA ! Great Stuff :)

fields.description: When cut and pasting a URL, sometimes a space is included at the end of the URL.  A custom URL field will say this is an "invalid URL".  The field should trim the space before doing the url check.
fields.summary: For custom URL fields, url should trim any spaces

fields.description: The Method Name label uses the alt/n shortcut and so does the Next button. All other R# wizard dialogs use alt/n for the Next button. Workflow is interrupted by this confict.
fields.summary: Extract Method dialog has conflicting keyboard shortcut key
Notification Scheme - Add additional configuration point of Status

fields.description:
1. Create 2 filters
2. on filter 1 click Manage
3. then click "share"
4. in a new tab, view the search results of filter 2
5. back in the previous tab, submit the form choosing who to share the filter with

filter 2 will have been shared instead of filter 1 because the filter selected is retrieved from the "current filter" mechanism implemented by the user session
fields.summary: Share filter picks up "current filter" in session instead of the one I clicked to share

fields.description:
JIRA should be enhanced with global permission of managing filters.
The owner of this permission gets use and manage access to all filters defined in Jira. 
By default this could be assigned to JIRA system admins.
Currently filter access introduces severeal problem in environment of big and diverse 
userbase with many changed happening every day.
fields.summary: Filter Management Global Permission

fields.description:
JIRA should be enhanced with global permission of managing filters.
The owner of this permission gets use and manage access to all filters defined in JIRA. 
By default this could be assigned to JIRA system administrators.
Currently filter access introduces several problems in environment of big and diverse 
userbase with many changes happening every day.
fields.summary: Filter Management Global Permission

fields.description:
This issue is related to this support ticket: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-21233

The customer has stated that he wasn't prompted to install JIRA as a service during the installer wizard, even though he was in the administrator's group for his computer.

At the start of the support issue he states the following:

    * My machine name is CHARLTON_D630 (It's a Dell laptop)
    * This laptop is normally connected to my company's intranet and it is joined to a domain (SAIC-US-EAST)
    * charltonw is the domain account I use to log into the company domain
    * The user charltonw is in CHARLTON_D630's administrator group.
    * Even when I am disconnected from the domain (e.g., working at home), I login to the machine using this domain account. In fact I was disconnected from the domain, but logged in using this domain account when I downloaded, installed, and configured JIRA at home.

This needs some further investigation here to determine if it was a misunderstanding by the customer or a valid bug.
fields.summary: Admin User not prompted to install JIRA as a service during installation wizard

fields.description: Under Admin User Browser, I can only filter by email but not username. This is annoying! Please add filter by more options.
fields.summary: Allow search user by username instead only email

fields.description: When I delete a version under administer project  and select to set the fix version of the issues using it to blank I would expect that the issue level change would be recorded on the "All"  tab version history for the changed issues.
fields.summary: Deleting version under administer project doesn't update each issue's version history

fields.description:
In order to be able to cache issues, and improve performance I need to fetch a list (of either id's or issues themselves) that are either deleted or updated since the last time I checked this. I would like to provide a date/time as an argument of course.

A method: String[] getIssueIdsForProject(String token, String[] projectKeys, String searchTerms, Date changedSince, int maxNumResults) would be sufficient I think. I could then try to fetch the new issues one by one, if some are deleted, I guess I will find out. 

Another altertative would be: String[] getIssueIdsForProject(String token, String[] projectKeys, String searchTerms) plus RemoteIssue[] getIssuesForProject(String token, String[] projectKeys, String searchTerms, Date changedSince, int maxNumResults). Hence you can use the first method to figure out if some issues have been deleted. And then use the second method to get all the updated issues. This is probably a better solution?
fields.summary: Fetch only updated or changed issues

fields.description:
*User symptoms:*

If you have downloaded the BugzillaImportBean.java source from our [docs|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/bugzilla_import.html], and have modified the {{getUsernameFromBugzillaProfile()}} method so that you can apply custom transformations to user names when checking against the existing JIRA users, the custom transformations currently do not get applied when creating a component from Bugzilla data.

For example, if you have a user in your Bugzilla data who's username is "john_smith" and who is the component lead for some component, and your {{getUsernameFromBugzillaProfile()}} method transforms usernames of the form "first_last" to "first.last", then when you import the data from Bugzilla, you will end up with two users created in your JIRA data: "john_smith" and "john.smith".

*Technical details:*

This problem occurs because the method {{getComponentLead()}} does not utilise the {{getUsernameFromBugzillaProfile()}} method, and instead directly grabs the username of the component lead out of the ResultSet object. All other dealings with user names in the BugzillaImportBean utilise this method.
fields.summary: Username for component lead during Bugzilla import does not follow custom mapping
Typo in summary-topleft.vm

fields.description:
*User symptoms:*

Generally, Lucene searches taking upwards of 10 seconds each time. Examples:
- Calculating aggregate time tracking information for a set of issues takes a long time
- Lazy loading portlets (Saved Filters portlet) takes a long time to display the counts of issues in each filter

Note that the performance issues are more problematic for users with more permissions in the JIRA instance. That is, an administrator with full access to every project and issue security level with suffer a greater performance hit than a user with more restricted permissions for the same query.

*Technical information:*

In Lucene, a {{CachingWrapperFilter}} can be used to wrap another filter, so that the resulting {{BitSet}} (which is used to filter out matching results from a search) is cached, because this {{BitSet}} can be expensive to create when there are a lot of terms in the underlying query.

In JIRA, there is a bug that means that the {{CachingWrapperFilter}} for each {{SearchRequest}} and user is never cached, meaning that every time it is used, the {{BitSet}} needs to be reconstructed. If this is remedied, there will be a significant speed increase to Lucene queries in JIRA instances with a large number of projects and/or issue security levels, as this filter is used extensively throughout the Lucene subsystem.
fields.summary: Suboptimal performance for Lucene queries within JIRA instances with a large number of projects and issue security levels

fields.description:
It would be useful to allow to assign a single workflow scheme to multiple projects in a single operation.

Currently to perform this task you need to navigate to each of the projects and associate them one by one with the given workflow scheme.

It is not a big problem if there is only a few project involved, although for a significant number of projects it is time consuming process.
fields.summary: Allow to assign single workflow scheme to multiple projects in one operation
Add option to create link back to the parent issue when converting sub-task to an issue

fields.description:
Hi,

I think the documentation should be more explicit when in comes to [Watcher Lists | http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/voterswatchers.html]. The reader may be lead to think that as soon as someone starts watching issues, they will receive notification. This is only so if a notification scheme has been set to do that. We may consider adding some note saying that they will receive email notifications if the administrator has configured Jira to do so...

Regards
fields.summary: Watcher list documentation could be misleading
Search suggestions for JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14974].
  {panel}

With a single email POP server we can make use of *catchmail* to route such mail to a nominated project.  Thats great, now do it for 90 project, 1000 project?

Manually configuring numerous services entries to enable email delivery to the projects is a royal pain.

To fix this, Ive modified the CreateIssueHandler (and I think AbstractMessageHandler, submitted under [JRA-14973]) to enable a single Handler to automatically lookup the projectkey from the email address, so just ONE entry is required for *n* projects.

The scenario supporting how this works is setting up a Virtual Mailbox, so all mail to a given domain 'whatever@jira.server.net' ends up in a single mailbox.  After this, the to: address just has the domain stripped off and upper cased to check for a project.

Please take this into codebase so I don't have to keep building it!
fields.summary: CreateIssueHandler patch (autoAssign emails to Projects based on email TO: address

fields.description:
As it stands, Jira's ability to identify a user based on their email is unusable in my environment.  We have many users that have short ID's, eg "auser"and an email address of various formats such as "auser@company.com", "first.lastname@company.co.uk", "first.lastname@company.com".   Any of these email accounts could be used to send mail to Jira, which doesn't help.

To fix this problem I've modified the Handler to make the lookup of USERID from EMAIL a pluggable feature, with implementation specified as a handler parameter.  This lead to [JRA-14954] which this issue also fixes.

I've written an Microsoft Active Directory 'plugin' to the handler which does all required cross-matching of email aliases to be able to find a valid sender, this makes use of an [LDAPUtil library|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/LDAP+Util+library] I did a while back for [Confluence CSUM Plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Custom+Space+User+Management+Plugin].  The default behaviour is made available through this mechanism.  The LDAP library is still in 'head' and needs versioning (next job) and was GPL3 but Ill fix that to be BSD - so who knows what may happen there.

I attach this fix in the hope that it will be integrated into the main code-base so I don't have to keep building it every new release, and others may find it useful.
fields.summary: AbstractMessageHandler patch (provides pluggable findUserByEmail, and external property file support for handler params + inbound issue creation fixes for Component,Priority,IssueType,Assignee)
Wiki-rendered diffs for email notifications or change history when a wiki-text-rendered field is edited.

fields.description:
A support customer has legitimately complained that http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Plugins does not inform him that many of these plugins are not supported. He thought that we were offering these as solutions. 

We do provide a warning about this on the home page of the JIRA Extensions space, http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Home. Unfortunately, we do not also include this warning in the sub-pages of that space. We really should. We could use the "excerpt" macro to do this.

(Doing a search on "JIRA Plugins" on http://confluence.atlassian.com will lead you to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Plugins, not http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Home.)
fields.summary: Warning about unsupported plugins needed in sub-pages of JIRA Extensions space on http://confluence.atlassian.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14967].
  {panel}

Feel free to move this to a 3rd party bug or Improvement if it's not a bug as I'm not 100% positive.

In our WSDL, it describes RemoteIssue like this:

{code}
      <complexType name="RemoteIssue">
	<complexContent>
	<extension base="tns1:AbstractRemoteEntity">
             <sequence>
             <element name="affectsVersions" nillable="true" type="impl:ArrayOf_tns1_RemoteVersion"/>
             <element name="assignee" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
             <element name="attachmentNames" nillable="true" type="impl:ArrayOf_xsd_string"/>
             <element name="components" nillable="true" type="impl:ArrayOf_tns1_RemoteComponent"/>
             <element name="created" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"/>
             <element name="customFieldValues" nillable="true" type="impl:ArrayOf_tns1_RemoteCustomFieldValue"/>
             <element name="description" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
             <element name="duedate" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"/>
             <element name="environment" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
             <element name="fixVersions" nillable="true" type="impl:ArrayOf_tns1_RemoteVersion"/>
             <element name="key" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"/>
.
.
.
{code}

When the actual response is returned, it inserts *ID* (derived from AbstractRemoteEntity) after *fixVersions* which differs from the WSDL sequence.

{code}
.
.
.
      <description xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
      <duedate xsi:type="xsd:dateTime" xsi:nil="true"/>
      <environment xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
      <fixVersions soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteVersion[1]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array">
        <fixVersions href="#id2"/>
      </fixVersions>
      <id xsi:type="xsd:string">10001</id>
      <key xsi:type="xsd:string">AAAA-2</key>
.
.
. 
{code}

A customer is reporting that their SOAP client by Tibco generates this error when using RemoteIssue:
{code}
caused by: org.xml.sax.SAXException: validation error: unexpected content "affectsVersions"; expected "id" ({com.tibco.xml.validation}COMPLEX_E_UNEXPECTED_CONTENT) at /getIssueResponse[1]/getIssueReturn[1]/affectsVersions[1]
{code}

Just to verify, simulating what a RemoteIssue response should look like in SOAPUI, it places ID at the top of the ordering.
fields.summary: RemoteIssue SOAP response sequence out of order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14966].
  {panel}

define a filter
give it a column order
give it a sort order
run the filter
observe that the permlink URL correctly contains the ordering fields, but does not list the columns in the filter

This means that if the permlink is sent to a user with a different default filter column set, the permlink will not give the same view of the data
fields.summary: permlink does not store the configured columns of a filter in the url

fields.description:
If you have given group "Anyone" Assignable user permission, the list of assignable users only contains "Unassigned"

This problem has been fixed by JRA-1926, but looks like it was reintroduced, as it is present in JIRA 3.12.3.
fields.summary: Assignable user doesn't list users if group anyone is attached

fields.description:
Need to repoint all the links in the forrest docs that point to API docs to point to docs.atlassian.com rather than www.atlassian.com.

Some of the links I am aware of:

URLs that begin with http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/ need to begin with to http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/ So http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/latest/ need to point to http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/latest/ and http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/3.12.3/ needs to point to http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/3.12.3/


I thihk we should search the whole forrest docs for something like  "docs/api" and see if those links need to be changed.
fields.summary: Update API docs link is JIRAs forrest docs

fields.description:
There is a strange behavior with Jira Charting plugin.  My Jira instance is set to English language but I'm using a French-language browser.  Some reports pre-rendered by this plugin are listed in French and some in English on my UI.  Here is what I can read from reports listing when browsing in a project:

Demandes Soumises Récemment
Demandes Soumises vs Résolues
Temps de Résolution
Average Age Report
Pie Chart Report
...
fields.summary: Some reports from Charting plugin are listed in French and some in English

fields.description: When a ticket is closed, the remaining time on the ticket is not zero-ed out. Lets say that someone opens ticket with an original estimated time as 2 weeks. A week later, this person logs time as 1 week spent. Then next, this person closes the ticket as it was completed earlier than expected. However, if this person forgets to set the time remaining to zero, JIRA lets the remaining time estimate stay at where it was (1 week). Once the ticket is closed it can't be updated unless it is re-opened. Now this shows up in the time tracking report as time remaining on the project task, which is not accurate. At the same time closed tickets can't be edited, so its a problem.
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't set the estimated time left field to zero when the ticket is closed.
Add Jelly Tag to update existing Custom Fields

fields.description:
If you copy paste the attached text into a JIRA comment, adding text after the paste, everything will be cut off following a particular line break.  I opened this in TextMate on MacOS X Leopard.   The problem line break appears at the line

 remaining name 'CN=Murakami\, Takahiro,OU=EAJ User Lists - Local Development/Licensing,DC=eaj,DC=ad,DC=ea,DC=com'

See the comment below for the behavior.  Seems to have to do with Wiki Rendering.  Breaks in description without the noformat macro but in comments, it does break when using the noformat macro.
fields.summary: Comments truncated when using {noformat} macro for wiki-rendering.

fields.description:
At the moment, when an issue is moved (project or issue type) and the workflow has to be changed, the notification e-mail contains the workflow change item. This is useless information in the e-mail, and should not be shown.

Example:

{noformat}
     [ https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-18798?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:all-tabpanel ]

Jeff Turner moved JST-172 to CSP-18798:
---------------------------------------

    Customer Status: Unknown
           Workflow: Support Workflow v.20  (was: Support Workflow - awaiting fix branch - v.23)
                Key: CSP-18798  (was: JST-172)
            Project: Confluence Support  (was: JIRA Studio Support)
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: Do not include Workflow change items in notification e-mails

fields.description:
Currently when an issue changes workflow, a change item is added, eg.:

| Support Workflow - awaiting fix branch - v.23 |Support Workflow v.20 |

I think this is not a good idea.

*Conceptually*: the workflow belongs to the project/issue type, not individual issues. Why log changes of applicable workflow, and not change of applicable permission scheme, notification scheme, or issue type scheme?

*In practice*: there are various disadvantages:
 - Messing with the issue history causes the 'Updated' date to be changed. Lots of people already complained about this and we 'fixed' it (JRA-7831).
 - It simply fills the change history with useless information.
 - It is a very mild form of security leak. When creating a workflow I never expected its name to be visible to customers.
 - it appears in email notifications when issues are moved to a project with a different workflow. Eg. here is a support notification that went to a customer:
{noformat}
     [ https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-18798?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:all-tabpanel ]

Jeff Turner moved JST-172 to CSP-18798:
---------------------------------------

    Customer Status: Unknown
           Workflow: Support Workflow v.20  (was: Support Workflow - awaiting fix branch - v.23)
                Key: CSP-18798  (was: JST-172)
            Project: Confluence Support  (was: JIRA Studio Support)
...
{noformat}

The workflow change is just confusing and irrelevant to customers.

So overall, logging the workflow change is a bad idea in concept and also in practice.
fields.summary: Don't add workflow changes to the issue change history.

fields.description:
Links to JIRA API docs on this page are broken:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+RPC+Services

This is probably related to JRA-14950.
fields.summary: Links to Java docs from JIRA RPC Services page are broken

fields.description:
I would like to be able to perform a search filtered on the issues I am watching. At work we use jira and have a portlet that displays customized columns for a filter. I'd like to be able to create a portlet that displays, for example, items I am watching for a project in an open state.

The watchlist portlet we have available does not allow sorting on any of the columns in the portlet, whereas the filter portlets allow sorting and many other useful features.

The watchlist is nigh useless for browsing.
fields.summary: Make items I am watching available as a filter

fields.description:
Im working on a customization of the AbastractMessageHandler to make it work in my Corporate environement, however, my last additional param caused the following udring editing the Handler parameters:


    * Error occurred trying to update service properties: com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.IllegalPropertyException: String exceeds 255 characters.


As I want to get this fixed, I'm going to further extend this class to support an external property file, to workaround the problem and will submit later.
fields.summary: AbstractMessageHandler suffers from limitation in customization due to handler parameter length limited to 255chars

fields.description:
_This issue was originally created in the WEB project (WEB-1059):_

Inside this document on [Creating a SOAP Client|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+SOAP+Client], there is a URL to JiraSoapService pointing to: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/rpc-jira-plugin/latest/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soap/JiraSoapService.html

That link is dead.
fields.summary: JIRA SOAP Client documentation link broken
